title: Instruments Electrical Connector Disconnect/Connect and Pin Numbering

body.body: Instruments Electrical Connector Disconnect/Connect and Pin Numbering
Never pull directly on the wires when disconnecting an electrical connector.
If you pull on the wires, the connector or the wires can become damaged.
Notice - General - Never disconnect ECM with ignition ON
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position.
Disconnecting an ECM with the ignition set to ON can cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first, before you disconnect an ECM.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
Damage to the connector pins may result if an attempt to fit the connectors incorrectly is made.
Instruments DP5; DR5; DS5; HF8; HG8; HJ8; HK8; HL8; LG1; LGX; LJ2; LK2; LL1
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Instruments.
As viewed on the mating face with the instruments (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: LH2; LG2; LM2; LL2; DP5; HF8; LK2; LJ2; LGX; DS5; DR5; HL8; HK8; HJ8; HG8; LL1; LG1
